code: deferred_method_transform <- function(lambda_expr, transformer, eval_env) {   transformer <- enexpr(transformer)   force(eval_env)    unique_id <- new_id()   env_bind_lazy(     generators,     !!unique_id := inject((!!transformer)(!!lambda_expr)),     eval.env = eval_env   )    inject(     function(...) {       (!!generators)[[!!unique_id]](self, private, ...)     }   ) } #' #' Transform a deferred method #' #' @description #' A short description... #' #' @param lambda_expr A lambda expression to transform. #' @param transformer A transformer function or expression. #' @param eval_env The environment in which to evaluate the transformer. #' #' @returns #' A function that, when called, will evaluate the transformed lambda expression. #' The returned function accepts `...` arguments which are passed to the generated function. #' #' @export set_default <- function(value, default, arg = caller_arg(value)) {   if (is.null(value)) {     if (!is_testing() || is_snapshot()) {       cli::cli_inform("Using {.field {arg}} = {.val {default}}.")     }     default   } else {     value   } } #' Set default value #' #' @description #' A short description... #' #' @param value A value to check. #' @param default The default value to use if `value` is NULL. #' @param arg Optional. The name of the argument being set. #' #' @returns #' Returns `value` if it's not NULL, otherwise returns `default`. #' Informs the user when using the default value. #' #' @export find_index <- function(left, e_right) {   if (!is.list(e_right) || !has_name(e_right, "index") || !is.numeric(e_right$index)) {     return(NA)   }    matches_idx <- map_lgl(left, function(e_left) e_left$index == e_right$index)   if (sum(matches_idx) != 1) {     return(NA)   }   which(matches_idx)[[1]] } #' Find matching index #' #' @description #' A short description... #' #' @param left A list of elements, each expected to have an 'index' field. #' @param e_right A list with an 'index' field to search for in `left`. #' #' @returns #' The numeric index in `left` where `e_right$index` matches, or NA if not found #' or if inputs are invalid. Returns NA if multiple matches are found. #' #' @export

text: Adjusted default recommended models documentation (#98). Local models: time chores’ last release, open-weights models reasonably run high-end laptop didn’t trick powering chores helpers. Qwen3 4B Instruct 2507 release changed ; model provides high-accuracy responses low latency high-end laptops. See “Getting started chores” vignette information. OpenAI: GPT-4o GPT-4o-mini transitioned GPT 4.1 GPT 4.1 mini, respectively. Anthropic: Claude Sonnet 3.5 -> Claude Sonnet 3.7. Note Sonnet 3.7 newest available minimally-thinking model Anthropic. newer models like Sonnet Haiku 4.5 tend introduce backticks responses struggle strictly follow requested output format. Reduced cli helper prompt ~4,100 ~2,300 tokens compatibility default context window lenth ollama LM Studio, 4096. Previously, applications silently truncate prompt, resulting model receiving access critical instructions response format appearing ignore entirely. default helper prompts already well default limit. Introduced chores.chat chores.dir preferred option names, following standard R package option naming conventions. legacy options .chores_chat .chores_dir continue work deprecated (#99). Bumped minimum version streamy package 0.2.1, resolve issue newlines removed multi-line file writes Positron (#96).
